try:
    print(5/0)
except ZeroDivisionError:
    print("You can't divide zero!")

print("Give me two numbers,and I'll divide them.")
print("Enter'q' to quit.")

while True:
    first_number = input('\nFist number: ')
    if first_number == 'q':
        break
    second_number = input('\nsecond number: ')
    if second_number == 'q':
        break
    answer = int(first_number) / int(second_number)
    print(answer)

ZeroDivisionError: division by zero

# å¼‚å¸¸
print("Give me two numbers,and I'll divide them.")
print("Enter'q' to quit.")

while True:
    first_number = input('\nFist number: ')
    if first_number == 'q':
        break
    second_number = input('\nsecond number: ')
    if second_number == 'q':
        break
    try:
        answer = int(first_number) / int(second_number)
    except ZeroDivisionError:
        print("You can't divide zero!")
    else:
        print(answer)

second number: 0

second number: 3

Fist number: q

class MyError(Exception):
    def __init__(self,value):
        super(MyError,self).__init__(value)
        self.value=value
        

raise MyError("Error Information")

å·¥ä½œæ–¹å¼ï¼š

  • é¦–å…ˆæ‰§è¡Œtryå­å¥ã€‚è‹¥æ²¡æœ‰å‘ç”Ÿä»»ä½•å¼‚å¸¸ï¼Œexceptå­å¥ä¼šåœ¨tryå­å¥æ‰§è¡Œå®Œåè¢«å¿½ç•¥ã€‚

        x = 1/0

    this_fails()

    print('Handling run-time error:', err)

try-except-else ç»“æ„Â¶

å·¥ä½œæ–¹å¼ï¼š

  • è‹¥tryèŒƒå›´å†…æ•è·äº†exceptè¯­å¥æŒ‡å®šçš„å¼‚å¸¸ï¼Œå°±è·³åˆ°exceptè¯­å¥ä¸­ç»§ç»­æ‰§è¡Œï¼›

ç¤ºä¾‹ï¼š

try:
    myfile=open('myfile.txt','w')
except:
    print('myfile open failed')
else:
    print('myfile open successfully')
    myfile.close()

myfile open successfully

class Error(Exception):
    """Base class for exceptions in this module."""
    pass

class InputError(Error):
    """Exception raised for errors in the input.

    Attributes:
        expression -- input expression in which the error occurred
        message -- explanation of the error
    """

    def __init__(self, expression, message):
        self.expression = expression
        self.message = message

class TransitionError(Error):
    """Raised when an operation attempts a state transition that's not
    allowed.

    Attributes:
        previous -- state at beginning of transition
        next -- attempted new state
        message -- explanation of why the specific transition is not allowed
    """

    def __init__(self, previous, next, message):
        self.previous = previous
        self.next = next
        self.message = message

finallyè¯­å¥æ˜¯æŒ‡æ— è®ºæ˜¯å¦å¼•å‘å¼‚å¸¸ï¼Œæ˜¯å¦è¢«æ•è·éƒ½ä¸€å®šä¼šæ‰§è¡Œçš„ä»£ç å—ã€‚

try-finallyè¯­å¥Â¶

è¿™ç§ç»„åˆå…¶å®æ— æ³•æ•æ‰å¼‚å¸¸

å·¥ä½œæ–¹å¼ï¼š

  • è‹¥æ²¡æœ‰å‘ç”Ÿå¼‚å¸¸ï¼Œåˆ™å…ˆè¿è¡Œtryå­å¥ï¼Œç„¶åè¿è¡Œfinallyå­å¥ï¼›

  • è‹¥å‘ç”Ÿå¼‚å¸¸ï¼Œåˆ™æ‰§è¡Œfinallyå­å¥ï¼Œç„¶åæŠŠå¼‚å¸¸é€’äº¤ç»™ä¸Šå±‚try,æ§åˆ¶æµä¸ä¼šé€šè¿‡æ•´ä¸ªtryè¯­å¥ã€‚

ç±»ä¼¼çš„è¿˜æœ‰ï¼š

## try-except-else-finallyè¯­å¥

finallyè¯­å¥çš„ç‰¹æ€§ï¼šÂ¶

  • å½“åœ¨tryè¯­å¥ä¸­å«æœ‰returnè¯­å¥æ—¶ï¼Œæ‰§è¡Œåˆ°returnå¹¶ä¸ä¼šç›´æ¥è¿”å›ï¼Œè€Œæ—¶åœ¨æ‰§è¡Œfinallyè¯­å¥åå†æ‰§è¡Œreturnè¯­å¥ï¼›

  • æœ‰æ—¶åœ¨å¤„ç†ç©finallyä¸­çš„èµ„æºé‡Šæ”¾ä¹‹åå°±ä¸éœ€è¦ç»§ç»­å¤„ç†æŠ›å‡ºçš„å¼‚å¸¸äº†ï¼Œè¿™è¿™ç§æƒ…å†µä¸‹å¯ä»¥è€ƒè™‘åœ¨finallyè¯­å¥å—ä¸­ä½¿ç”¨returnè¯­å¥ã€‚

å¤„ç†å¼‚å¸¸çš„ç‰¹æ®Šæ–¹æ³•Â¶
